an10.116:1.1: Then the wanderer Ajita went up to the Buddha, and exchanged greetings with him.
an10.116:1.2: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, he sat down to one side and said to the Buddha,
an10.116:2.1: “Master Gotama, we have a spiritual companion called ‘The Philosopher’.
an10.116:2.2: He has worked out around five hundred arguments by which followers of other paths will know when they’ve been refuted.”
an10.116:3.1: Then the Buddha said to the mendicants,
an10.116:3.2: “Mendicants, do you remember this philosopher’s points?”
an10.116:3.3: “Now is the time, Blessed One! Now is the time, Holy One!
an10.116:3.4: Let the Buddha speak and the mendicants will remember it.”
an10.116:4.1: “Well then, mendicants, listen and pay close attention, I will speak.”
an10.116:5.1: “Mendicants, take a certain person who rebuts and quashes unprincipled statements with unprincipled statements. This delights an unprincipled assembly,
an10.116:5.3: ‘He’s a true philosopher! He’s a true philosopher!’
an10.116:6.1: Another person rebuts and quashes principled statements with unprincipled statements. This delights an unprincipled assembly,
an10.116:6.3: ‘He’s a true philosopher! He’s a true philosopher!’
an10.116:7.1: Another person rebuts and quashes principled and unprincipled statements with unprincipled statements. This delights an unprincipled assembly,
an10.116:7.3: ‘He’s a true philosopher! He’s a true philosopher!’
an10.116:8.1: Mendicants, you should know bad principles and good principles.
an10.116:8.2: And you should know bad results and good results.
an10.116:8.3: Knowing these things, your practice should follow the good principles with good results.
an10.116:9.1: So what are bad principles? What are good principles? What are bad results? And what are good results?
an10.116:9.2: Wrong view is a bad principle.
an10.116:9.3: Right view is a good principle.
an10.116:9.4: And the many bad, unskillful qualities produced by wrong view are bad results.
an10.116:9.5: And the many skillful qualities fully developed because of right view are good results.
an10.116:10.1: Wrong thought is a bad principle.
an10.116:10.2: Right thought is a good principle. …
an10.116:10.3: Wrong speech is a bad principle.
an10.116:10.4: Right speech is a good principle. …
an10.116:10.5: Wrong action is a bad principle.
an10.116:10.6: Right action is a good principle. …
an10.116:10.7: Wrong livelihood is a bad principle.
an10.116:10.8: Right livelihood is a good principle. …
an10.116:10.9: Wrong effort is a bad principle.
an10.116:10.10: Right effort is a good principle. …
an10.116:10.11: Wrong mindfulness is a bad principle.
an10.116:10.12: Right mindfulness is a good principle. …
an10.116:10.13: Wrong immersion is a bad principle.
an10.116:10.14: Right immersion is a good principle. …
an10.116:10.15: Wrong knowledge is a bad principle.
an10.116:10.16: Right knowledge is a good principle. …
an10.116:11.1: Wrong freedom is a bad principle.
an10.116:11.2: Right freedom is a good principle.
an10.116:11.3: And the many bad, unskillful qualities produced by wrong freedom are bad results.
an10.116:11.4: And the many skillful qualities fully developed because of right freedom are good results.
an10.116:12.1: ‘You should know bad principles and good principles.
an10.116:12.2: And you should know bad results and good results.
an10.116:12.3: Knowing these things, your practice should follow the good principles with good results.’
an10.116:12.4: That’s what I said, and this is why I said it.”
